Valentines Gift For Girlfriend - What Do Girls Like on Valen

gift for girlfriendWhen you are attempting to be friends with your ex girlfriend, you will feel a sense of dread as a birthday or holiday approaches. You know that you wish to get her a present, however you don't want to send her the incorrect message.

The kind of gift you provide your ex girlfriend is crucial and depends on many factors. Is she during a new relationship? Do you continue to have feelings for her? Do you want to urge back together?

If you would like to induce back together along with your ex, then your gift choice is even more important. Follow the recommendation in these dos and don'ts to get some great concepts.

Do select a present based on something that she said. Do you keep in mind her saying something that she extremely likes? Perhaps she once mentioned her favorite childhood book or movie. Maybe she said one thing that she wanted however would never purchase for herself. When you offer her this kind of gift, she can be impressed with your memory and thoughtfulness.

Don't buy her lingerie or other sexy things. These are too suggestive for an ex boyfriend to give and can make her feel uncomfortable.

Do select something that she likes. When several people give gifts, they often select a gift based on their own tastes instead of the recipient's. When you select something based on her likes, she can realize that you care concerning her.

Do not send her flowers or give a gift card. In most cases, these gifts are generic. It shows that you did not think abundant regarding what you wanted to induce her. It also may signify a last minute gift, that doesn't make her feel special.

Do purchase something that will remind her of something you probably did as a couple. A CD of a concert you visited along with her or an evening out at a favorite restaurant are both things that would create her suppose fondly of you.

Do not get her a gag gift. You'll be able to follow the traditions if you prefer, or do something uncommon or your approach to celebrate your wedding anniversary. Celebrations don't seem to be restricted to centenary, you can after all celebrate anytime, before or when the marriage. Here you can realize some traditional and contemporary ways in which of celebrating a 10 year of commitment.

The traditional tenth bicentennial gift is one thing created of tin. Tin symbolizes the endurance of the 10 year marriage. Finding romantic tin gifts aren't hard, you only have to be a very little inventive. Try jewelries that are created of tin, they're cheap and unusual. You can get your spouse a watch or clock with some distinctive design. Or any unusual occasional and tea mugs, vases, wine totes, picture frames, table ware, paper weight, candle holders and residential decors.

Whereas the modern gift idea for the 10th birthday would come with a gift of bijou made of diamond or blue sapphire. 10 years of marriage is sort of a milestone, whether or not that's a hoop, or necklace, pendant, or bracelet, pin, or etc, the gift would be appropriate for you to show your spouse your appreciate of the marriage.

If you don't understand how to place a resume along or don't extremely know how to write one, then rent somebody. Have them build it simply generic enough therefore you'll apply at varied firms and for varied positions. Yes the resumes get there. Is it worth it though?  In my experiment employing a professional writer's resume I got numerous requests from life insurance firms, financing firms, mortgage companies, investment corporations, credit card processing, advertising and several different a hundredp.c commission sales jobs. Throughout a recession these are both the businesses with the best turnover and the most desperate would like.  They pay recruiters the upper commissions. I got zero writers job interviews how attention-grabbing. Yet, one cowl letter sent to company directly that wasn't hiring, resulted in a rapid request for an interview even while not any resume. Thank you Yellow Pages.

<br>Resume distribution services are another quick means to make a buck off unknowing job hunters.  Unfortunately, the only approach this could work is to distribute one generic resume several times. You'll be able to do that at no cost by posting your resume online then creating any modification in it and posting it again. Each time you do this it will be listed again as a brand new resume at no cost.  Several job posting services even charge for most popular resume positioning.   What an outrage! This company conjointly posts business opportunities as if they were real jobs. The downside with these large companies is they're heartless. Anyone while not employment needs real honest facilitate in the midst of this recession.

<br>Forget about a generic resume and cover letter distribution. This may work for bound professions where there's a shortage of talent like in nursing. But for the vast majority of job hunters you are merely creating your employers/recruiters job harder. Now they have a stack of > 200 vs. Learn to inform your own story and obtain hired!

How to Maximize Your Resume's Real Estate

Real estate is not just about properties and land. It is how advertisers see ad space and net developers see internet pages - it is regarding the value of a explicit area at intervals any area, even resume space. Yes, a simple 8.5??eleven piece of paper is assets when turned into a resume.

However, it is a common mistake for job seekers to bury their best qualities, skills, and accomplishments in dangerous assets - hidden in long paragraphs, below irrelevant content, or maybe on subsequent pages, leaving the reader feeling unimpressed as a result of they can't find your best stuff. If you would like to promote your best qualities, you want to position them in the best place possible on your resume.

But, why? Because employers will take about thirty seconds to scan your resume for keywords, specific skills, measurable achievements, etc. and if your best assets are not advertised in key real estate, they will simply be overlooked.

Therefore, what is the best way to induce the most important aesthetic bang for your buck? Here are some suggestions.

What to send up front: Embody your most relevant and spectacular skills sets, experiences, and accomplishments at the prime of your resume to form a sturdy, targeted introduction. This sets the stage for the rest of your document and tells the reader who you're (before telling them what you've done). If you concentrate on a specific field, make certain trade-specific keywords and phrases are present here.

If you are field is technical in nature or needs in depth laptop knowledge, list your applicable skills and certifications "on top of the fold." That means put a bulleted list of your technical qualifications (e.g. C++, QuickBooks, CRM software, etc.) above the middle of the primary page.

Make it easy for them to achieve you. By that, I mean don't feel the necessity to list 2 phone numbers, a fax variety, a mailing address, email, personal URL, blog, LinkedIn, and on and on. Your address (in some cases simply city and state will do), email address, and one phone variety can suffice. This data should perpetually be at the prime of your resume below your name.

If you only completed a degree, list that higher than your skilled experience to indicate your information is current - and primarily to point out what you've got been up to during the past few years.

What to minimize or omit: I've seen many resumes that waste valuable page-one real estate on massive, fancy print, photos, personal information, or simply plain irrelevant data. Including these varieties of insignificant content can be detrimental to your search. The best approach to combat this is to browse the primary [*fr1] of your first page and raise yourself, "Is the content on this portion enough to keep the reader interested?" If the answer is not any, you wish to rethink that part of your resume.

Other aspects of your resume that should hang within the shadows (in poor property) embody job gaps, brief job tenure, and less relevant information which will not apply directly to your current field.

Once you begin to read your resume in terms of property, you'll begin to seeing where your best qualities will shine!
one buck resume

How to Make Your Resume Stand Out in a Crowded Job Market -

In part 1 of "How to make your resume stand out in a crowded job market," I talked about the resume itself and the 3 key components your resume needs to capture a decision maker's attention.

Just to recap, these 3 factors were... making sure your resume:

1 - Is branded
<br>2 - Is focused
<br>3 - Provides proof of your brand and statements by using quantifiable achievements and context.

In part 2 of this article, we're going to look at ways to actually get your resume into the hands of hiring managers.

After all, you could have put together a highly powerful resume, but if you use ineffective job search methods, it simply won't get noticed. Job searching has undergone some drastic "nip and tuck" the past few years. It's not just the economy that makes for a more competitive landscape. These days, your resume may not be the first thing a company sees from you. With the proliferation of social and business networking sites, it may be your online profile(s).

So you need to know how to craft your resume, but you also need to know how to market it, and market yourself. In the end, isn't it about companies showing an interest in you, whether it's through your resume or another medium? The majority of employers will Google you during the hiring process. They may even find you online to begin with, or be referred to you by someone who's seen your profile online.

The good news is that you can be in the driver's seat by going after the hidden job market and using social networking. You definitely don't want to passively apply to positions you see posted online. This has an average 2% "success" rate. To be truly successful in today's competitive job market, you need to use a combination of offline and online networking. It's still great to network in person and sometimes sending a hard copy of your resume will make you stand out in a time where email has become the norm. (Gen Y: that's what those little square pieces of paper - stamps - are for.)

All kidding aside, whatever you do, you always want to establish a connection or even a relationship. Even if it's through one of your contacts. If you can have your resume handed over to a decision maker by a key contact within your target company; great! That would be ideal. When going the online route, the emphasis should be on positioning yourself as an expert in your field vs. asking your network for a job. Social networking is perfect for this! You do this by commenting on other people's blogs that are relevant to your field, by having your own blog and web site - yes, a web site! - and by answering questions online, engaging in groups discussions, and posting articles about your expertise.

You also want to identify hiring managers - not HR! - at the companies you're interested in online so you can approach and target them with your messages. After a while, you'll be seen as an expert and a resource. Next, people may even approach you and refer you without you having to ask because you've created relationships within your network and provided value to others. It's crucial to avoid the mistake of asking people in your network for a job. It's needy and most people don't have jobs to hand out. This means: end of conversation. It's perfectly fine to ask for leads for informational interviews though.

With these strategies, you can work the hidden job market more easily as well. What this means is that you are going to find out about a company's hiring needs well before they're ever advertized or posted. But beware...when profiling yourself online, you need to know your own brand. Otherwise, you won't stand out or you may even send out the wrong message about yourself.

For tips on how to brand yourself, please refer back to part 1 of this article.

Combining the strategies from part 1 and part 2 will give you a very big competitive edge.

Readers, I'd love to hear your experiences with these strategies. Have you been able to carve out a niche for yourself online? Have you found a great way to get noticed? Which aspects of the job search do you find most challenging?
one buck resume

Jarir Nakouzi, M.D. Facing Disciplinary Action

Pursuant to the General Statutes of Connecticut, §§19a-10 and 19a-14, the Department of Public Health (hereinafter "the Department" brings the following charges against Jarir Nakouzi, MD.:

Jarir Nakouzi, M.D., of Trumbull, Connecticut (hereinafter "respondent" is, and has been at all times referenced in this Statement of Charges, the holder of Connecticut physician and surgeon license number 039115.

Respondent provided medical care to patient M.N. from on or about October 21, 2006 until on or about December 20,2006. M.N. presented with late stage inflammatory breast cancer with chest wall carcinoma, after radiation and chemotherapy had been unsuccessful.

Respondent's care for M.N. deviated from standard of care in one or more of the following ways:
a. he failed to obtain and/or failed to adequately document informed consent from M.N.;

b. he did not maintain adequate documentation of his course of care for M.N.; and/or

c. he prescribed high doses of oxycodone for pain, but did not appropriately document pain assessments or pain treatment planning.

Respondent's care for M.N. deviated from standard of care in that he failed to diagnose and/or treat M.N. appropriately in one or more of the following ways:
a. he failed to respond, and/or respond adequately, to a fungating necrotic wound on her chest wall;

b. he diagnosed unbalanced quadrants;

c. he used bioresonance as a diagnostic technique;

d. he diagnosed and treated homotoxins; and/or

e. he treated her with autosanguis.
<img src="
http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8465/8118495602_cf497288ea.jpg"; align="right" width="286" style="padding:10px;"/>
The above facts constitute grounds for disciplinary action pursuant to the General Statutes of Connecticut, §20-13c(4).
THEREFORE, the Department prays that:

The Connecticut Medical Examining Board, as authorized in §§ 19a-17 and 20-13c, revoke or order other disciplinary action against the physician and surgeon license of Jarir Nakouzi, M.D. as it deems appropriate and consistent with law.
Jarir Nakouzi, M.D. Facing Disciplinary Action
Dr Jarir Nakouzi, Jarir Nakouzi MD, Jarir Nakouzi
